ahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> Tino's paper uses ESP, s=
o it doesn't really address the complexity
> question.  But I have actually=
 done length changing experiments myself
> that haven't been published.  I =
found I could get to the first
> increment in length without needing increm=
ental evolution in NEAT.  I
> think it took several hundred generations, an=
d actually the network
> was significantly more complex than the usual DPB =
network (which may
> even have zero hidden nodes).  In fact, you've all pro=
bably seen this

wer: It's the network in the picture that's been on top
> of the NEAT Users=
 Page for years :)

>=

=

t problem.
